Negative_Review: Didn t like the fact that the windows were sealed so no fresh air and air con was a bit too hot for us
Positive_Review: Great location near to Tube station for all of central London attractions and Kensington High Street so no need to pay for expensive food in hotel Clean and comfortable room Easy reach from Paddington and our cases were kept safe in the hotel on the last day so we could explore more of London before returning home

Negative_Review: They were unable to process our Amex Card Yet we had no trouble using it anywhere else in London
Positive_Review: Great position walk to Kensington Palace Hyde Park close to station buses Helpful staff great amenities comfortable good size rooms

Negative_Review: Was a little pricey and bed was not as comfortable as I had expected Two lifts were in need of repair and so avoided them Pleasant enough no WOW factor
Positive_Review: The position and restaurant selections were great and the club lounge provided a nice space for happy hour or just a quiet space during the day Staff were good and the stay was trouble free

Negative_Review: Need to work on the lifts elevators they weren t working correctly the entire week I even stepped out of an elevator twice because of alarm bells and malfunctions m
Positive_Review: Your staff is great The location of the property although a bit off the beaten path iit is the best combination of quiet and near enough An easy walk to a main street underground station and bustling activity

Negative_Review: Room keys did not work we were given the wrong room number Two of the lights did not work The hairdryer did not work Unhelpful and unpleasant staff no apology given for inconvenience caused Will not book this hotel again
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Room was very dark had a job to see no main lighting bed lamp didn t work but managed with the other one till that one blew Carpet by bathroom was wet and stained think there must have been a leak but all mentioned to staff to look into
Positive_Review: Nice to be upgraded to club class Great breakfast great view from bedroom and very comfortable Lovely Hotel very friendly staff and would definately stay here again

Negative_Review: The check in is very slow and the lifts are a nightmare to use as they don t make it clear to people that they need to use their room key You often see the same people just going up and down in very full lifts not able to figure out why the lift hasn t stopped on their floor
Positive_Review: the location is good

Negative_Review: The bed was quite old stained It was reasonably comfortable though A little TLC in the rooms would be beneficial glue up the peeling wallpaper etc
Positive_Review: The location was great everything was easily accessible The rooms were large light Check in out were very easy

Negative_Review: Right beside railway but noise not too bad Breakfast a bit underwhelming for 4 star hotel no veggie sausages for my veggie partner Cold croissants etc
Positive_Review: Staff v friendly and helpful great location just off kensington high street Facilties and room v good Fridge in room great extra

Negative_Review: We had booked 3 rooms one was for my disabled elderly mother in law and her carer The hotel did not have the correct number of beds in the rooms They kept us waiting for 0ver 3 hours trying to organise extra beds which never appeared When we eventually got beds for everyone the rooms reeked of cigarette smoke Some of the sausages at breakfast were half raw Perhaps they were trying to poison us It was a complete shambles None of the staff seemed to have a clue and mostly spoke poor English After 2 weeks we eventually received an apology and refund for one of the 3 rooms Would never stay here again under any circumstances
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Reception was poorly managed some of the lifts were not working properly There were not adequate towels placed in the room and we had to call a number of times before we got any After 1 night they again didn t sort the towels out and did not replenish the tea coffee until asked to There was also not enough toilet roll and we also had to ask for some more We complained to reception but they didn t seem to care but eventually offered to have the manager call us I still haven t heard from them
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: We booked a club room but it was just an ordinary room Poor quality toiletries no robes as advertised etc
Positive_Review: this hotel is well located near Kensington High Street

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Due to an event I was attending I contacted the hotel to enquire if I could drop my luggage off before room checkin I was informed I could do this The staff were very helpful on doing this When I did arrive to check in which was late at night the service was very prompt

Negative_Review: We had a very poor night s sleep because the mattress was far too firm and the synthetic pillows were hard We made a verbal complaint at reception and all they offered to do was to inform the management The lifts were operated via the room s swipe card but were temperamental stopping unexpectedly between floors on all but one journey we made We talked to fellow customers who said they had experienced the same problem We didn t report this because we had already complained about the bed Not surprisingly we won t be staying at the hotel again
Positive_Review: The location was good Very close to the tube bus and nice shops

Negative_Review: I didn t like having to come home
Positive_Review: I stay here every time I am in London The location facilities and above all the staff are so professional and helpful

Negative_Review: I have no complaint about this property
Positive_Review: Very close to public transportation restaurants stores and to tourist attractions The room was comfortable and a good sized The staff were exceptionally helpful I would definitely go back in the future

Negative_Review: club lounge breakfast cold brassiere also no cookies or muffins just plain biscuits no afternoon tea Service in the club lounge in the morning a shamble Staff at reception not very helpful
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Breakfast very crowded and slightly chaotic Coffee was lukewarm and seemed to be served whenever it suited the waiters rather than the customer No hash browns or other form of potato and no omelette fresh egg station which has now become common in most hotels At 13 50 per person breakfast was poor value and there was no light alternative breakfast without leaving the hotel
Positive_Review: Room was clean and comfortable Hotel is well located being close to the Underground and within walking distance of Royal Albert Hall Kensington Palace etc

Negative_Review: The bath room flooded when we showered The maintenance man who came to fix it was surly and grumpy He used all the towels to mop the water and left them in a soggy heap on the bathroom floor The radiator leaked we were woken by the drip drip I used a glass and our towels to soak up the water
Positive_Review: I liked the breakfasts the efficiency of the reception staff and the location The conference I attended was in a well ventilated room Lunch involved long queues which took out a lot of the lunch time Could have been better explained and organised

Negative_Review: Slight frustration that there were no towels available on our arrival and we were not able to shower before going out in the evening after travelling all day staff did apologise but should not happen really
Positive_Review: The location is very good

Negative_Review: There were a few problems On arriving in the room found it was made up for a twin but we booked 9 double rooms so we had to ask to move There was only 1 towel in the room We had to ask 3 times to get an extra towel which finally arrived at gone midnight Twice during the evening and next morning we had to get the key reset for the room as it did not work This was annoying after getting to the room and having to go all the way back to reception
Positive_Review: This is the 6th time of staying at the hotel The location is fantastic and very convenient

Negative_Review: I m not a fan of carpeting
Positive_Review: The hotel is not the prettiest on the outside but the room was clean and staff was friendly and helpful Only a few minute s walk from High Street Kensington tube station

Negative_Review: Elevator
Positive_Review: Strategic location many eateries and shopping outlets nearby ATM machine in the ground floor so i don t need to find currency exchange outlets

Negative_Review: Found the room very hot stuffy at night even if we did have the aircon on full bore all day everyday and it was cold outside Had to sleep with the curtains open becoz of the way the aircon faces so early starts every morning
Positive_Review: Taxi waiting outside mostdays or 100m round the corner close to tube

Negative_Review: Television didn t work very well and a booked wake up call wasn t made
Positive_Review: The location is excellent parking is very convenient Room was comfortable and quiet

Negative_Review: The pillow is quite flat only one bathrobe and 1 pair of bedroom slipper provided The breakfast spread remains the same for the 5 days that i was there
Positive_Review: The location is great with shops restaurants cafes nearby The lounge room and lounge floor makes me feel more secure as I wa travelling alone with my 10yr old

Negative_Review: Bit chaotic with poor communication Room not fully ready although we d spoken to them about early check in and they d confirmed okay But when we came back several hours later they said no room was ready and to come back in an hour or pay to upgrade to a more expensive room Finally they got us in a room that wasn t really ready bed configuration was wrong so someone had to come and rearrange the room shower gel and other bathroom items not fully stocked so we had to call down for those But they did sort these later when we asked Just took about an hour to get room sorted Content and decor in room and bathroom a little old and worn but clean and sufficient and comfortable
Positive_Review: Staff friendly and tried to be helpful but was a little chaotic Place was clean and correct rooms good and comfortable

Negative_Review: No breakfast The lift were not very good Breakfast not included and yet price of room 110 per night and that was supposed to be a bargain
Positive_Review: There was terrible noise all morning on my last day How could they organise for loud drilling work to be done when there are gusts next door The lack of breakfast included was a bit tight considering the cost of the room

Negative_Review: The place was a lot older than I thought The mugs were sometimes not cleaned and the carpet was somewhat old and dusty A little bit of renovation work would really make this place better
Positive_Review: Regarding the other hotels nearby this hotel has bigger rooms considering the price The High Street Kensington station is only 3 min walk away and the underground tube easily takes you to the main spots in London in 15 20 mins

Negative_Review: The bed was just a double bed normally I have found hotels have king size Our friends who traveled with us found the double size too small My husband and I would have preferred king size too The bed was comfortable and we slept well enough though The furniture was a bit dated and could probably do with an upgrade but the room was very clean and a good size
Positive_Review: The breakfast choice and quality was very good All the staff were very friendly and helpful We actually had an excellent view over the city from our room as we were on the 12th floor However our friends who travelled with us were less fortunate as they were allocated the 5th floor

Negative_Review: We were given a disabled room and the automatic door was heavy and i was standing in the open door trying to take room service off the waiter when the door hit me really hard and nearly dropped the room service
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: I will not come back to this hotel It s old looks great on pictures but reality is disappointing
Positive_Review: Location is very good at Kensington with underground connection and a lot of buses

Negative_Review: Concierge acted like he could not be bothered to answer a question one morning However the desk clerk when we checked in was very pleasant There was not an elevator at the subway stop so it was difficult for me to get my luggage up the stairs upon arrival and down the stairs on departure
Positive_Review: Location to the subway was down a back alley nighttime was unnerving Location to a Marks and Spencer grocery store and other shopping was nice Very good location to see Kensington Palace and gardens

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The location of the hotel is great Near the underground and shops at High St Kensington The rooms are large and very clean Excellent value for money

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: We stayed in room 1133 and there was an issue with the electrics My husband switched the shower on and the bathroom light went off This concerned us and suggested that the electrics were problematic My husband did report the problem on two separate occasions Apart from that concern all was fine

Negative_Review: Breakfast was cold especially the tea and coffee Should not have to pay extra for a hot chocolate and then receive a poor and cold one Should be served in a pot
Positive_Review: Location was excellent and housekeeping service was quick Staff were lovely

Negative_Review: Poor air conditioning and very noisy
Positive_Review: Bed OK Cleaning could be better bath toilet very old need some renovation too many big furniture in the small room Some had spat in the hallway outside of room nr 323 it lay there for 4 days without being cleaned disgusting

Negative_Review: Check in too ages and staff disappeared into separate office for every check in I watched We were only 15 mins before checkin time but flatly refused to check if our room was available Could clearly hear the conversation from the couple in the next room
Positive_Review: Location

Negative_Review: Hotel had no details of my booking Tried to move us to another hotel After two hours of talks finally obtained the four rooms booked I will not be using your booking service or this hotel in the future
Positive_Review: Nothing

Negative_Review: Noticed the glass protecting the furniture needed to be cleaned underneath coffee And sugar granules had gathered The towels rather thin and frayed discoloured And unable to extend the check out time did not have a flight out untl 10 pm so long wait Prior to the lengthy return journey
Positive_Review: Beds comfortable however we were unable to alter the sound could not increase Love the tea and coffee facilities

Negative_Review: Perhaps some biscuits with the coffee tea facilities
Positive_Review: Convenient to underground shops Also walking distance to Kensington Gardens Good sized rooms with double bed

Negative_Review: THE ROOM FO A START tHE TOWELS IN THE BATHROOM WERE SO THIN IT WAS DIFFICULT TO GET PROPARLY DRIED THE FRIDGE WAS EMPTY WHICH I FOUND UNBEILEVABLE THE HOTEL IS STUCK UN THE SEVENTIES AND IS NOT ACCEPTABLETO ME
Positive_Review: Not Much The Reception was fine the room could benefit from a total upgade I didn t like it a all

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: This was a fabulous hotel my husband and I chose for our first wedding anniversary We were delighted to arrive and receive a complimentary upgrade and in our room we were overwhelmed to find a lovely card and cake to welcome and congraltualate us on our anniversary Could not reccomend this hotel enough so comfy and clean and great location

Negative_Review: Rooms were extremely tired dated and the furniture was not in good condition at all Carpet was horrendous like being time transported to the 80 s But I hasten to add it was very clean and the bed although small was comfortable enough The windows were designed not to be opened so had to have a noisy air cooling system on that was very loud if you wanted the room cool enough for comfort The rooms were fine for us as we just needed a bed for the night whilst we were out shopping and site seeing in the day To be fair I wasn t expecting much anyway as it was the only hotel with rooms left after booking to see Adele who later cancelled her concert But if you wanted to treat yourself and your partner I d advise pick another hotel or upgrade the room
Positive_Review: Breakfast was very good very good selection and tasty Staff were very friendly and efficient The loby and Resturant rooms were nice just a shame the bedrooms were not great Position was brilliant just a two minute walk to Kensington high street tube station on the circle and district lines and just two stops from paddington A couple of shops around that Close late boots etc and some cafes

Negative_Review: Initially allocated an extremely poor room We complained immediately and we were moved We did have to pay an extra 60
Positive_Review: Location and staff very helpful

Negative_Review: Nothing
Positive_Review: Lovely staff We were also lucky to be upgraded to guest of the day so had the added bonus of using the Executive Lounge If you can add this to your booking it is well worth it One of the most comfortable hotel beds I have slept in

Negative_Review: It s London it was pricey But that s to be expected
Positive_Review: The staff were without exception courteous and so helpful The breakfast was excellent Room clean quiet and comfortable

Negative_Review: I booked 2 rooms my friends room was ready but I had to wait until nearly 3 30pmfor my room
Positive_Review: Charles was exceptionally brilliant Gave us drinks vouchers for the bar as we had to leave before the free evening drinks I the Club Lounge

Negative_Review: Overall brilliant but you could hear the train a little in the morning but I am a very light sleeper anyway The breakfast was 30 for 2 guests so I would suggest maybe eat out or book breakfast when booking the room
Positive_Review: Comfy bed bathroom full of toiletry essentials hairdryer iron and fridge in room Got upgraded to a double room on arrival which was lovely No queues for the lift too

Negative_Review: The rooms were very very dated Windows didn t open air conditioning poor Bathroom also very very dated and shower not powerful enough didn t like the old fashion rubber mat that was in the bath to stop slipping gem holder
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: we missed free drinks in club suite due to a dinner already booked ready for the concert NO other issues during the stay
Positive_Review: We were the guests of the day So upgraded to club suite Fantastic room with excellent views of the city Breakfast was excellent all hot food was good and range was exceptional

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The view from the room was not great it looked out to the back of the hotel I was happy with that as it was lovely and quiet and could not hear traffic noise

Negative_Review: Hotel in need of refurbishment room worn down A lot of noise from underground track poor sound reduction in windows
Positive_Review: Great location very close to underground

Negative_Review: Breakfast is self service and we were later down the food was cold I would of complained on site but there were no staff around
Positive_Review: The size of the bed and the room in general was great

Negative_Review: The architecture is a shock I expected something grand given the location but Copthorne Tara is not grand Think functional and you ll be alright The windows didn t open The window unit was old and didn t work well which meant the room smelled musty and was too warm during a sunny summer visit Shower curtain smelled bad Could use some modern updates
Positive_Review: Location is excellent Very close to High Street Kensington Station

Negative_Review: Dont eat in the club lounge I found it to be quite small to cater for large mass of people at meal times Most staff are nice and accomodating but you do encounter a small number of staff that are rude and make sure you feel uncomfortable We ran out of toilet paper and it wasnt replaced during room service We rang concierge twice with no answer then attempted to contact reception which in turn transfered us to the same line again with no answer Please keep in mind I am not a whinger You just expect a standard of service for a facility that claims they are 4 stars
Positive_Review: A lovely lady named Mai checked us in and upgraded us to a club room Location was great Train station just a short walk and so easy to use Restaurants and convenient store onsite incase you get so tired to go out for meals

Negative_Review: In the up graded room the bed side lights witch did not work and so I had to turn the lights off by the door and find the bed in the dark
Positive_Review: The bathroom was on the small side for an upgraded room I could not see what extras the upgrade I paid for had given me

Negative_Review: Check in was a complete mess I had booked two club rooms and had previously spoke to reservation for two rooms adjacent one for me and one for my Daughter travelling from Toronto AND WAS ALLOCATED ROOMS 1269 AND 1271 ON THE 12TH FLOOR My daughter checked in and was allocated room 1269 Great I arrived an hour later and was told that the only room available was 1240 my room had been allocated to someone else I could not believe the incompetence After about 40 minutes they found two rooms together on the 11th floor So my Daughter had to move all her belongings from one room to another BREAKFAST being in a club room we had access to the club Lounge went for Breakfast could not get a table all occupied redirected to the Main breakfast room Took away the pleasure of eating in the CLUB lounge which we Paid for NOT IMPRESSED This Hotel certainly needs a manager
Positive_Review: Staff were good

Negative_Review: Crowds large groups everywhere tours small lobby area long quewes at reception area impossible to call reception during the busy day hours no one would answer staff mostly non British and not all understood the concept of good customer service very expensive food and drinks in the bar and restaurant restaurant set up for the tour groups and individual guests subject to large crowds and noise slow service stressed staff etc horrible and very scary old elevators harried front desk reception staff wish they would have told me about the small bar in the hotel off to the side that didn t cater to the large Tour groups overall lack of tranquility
Positive_Review: Location is excellent

Negative_Review: No bath robes in the room even after asking at reception Food was very expensive and not great
Positive_Review: Comfortable beds nice breakfast in the club room which was advertised as continental but did actually include a cooked breakfast

Negative_Review: Service in hotel was extremely slow Walked out of Asian restaurant as sat for so long without even getting a drink offered The tea at breakfast was disgusting 32 for 4 glasses of wine is daylight robbery
Positive_Review: Location was brilliant Very close to shops bars restaurants sight seeing and Tube 2 mins from hotel

Negative_Review: nearly 30 minutes to check in check in clerk was not aware of Artists Corner restaurant for which I had requested a reservation online and said it was not at that hotel Lunchtime service in the brasserie on 29th was very poor and two of the five dishes served were disappointing
Positive_Review: upgraded room because of poor service at reception was a bonus Nice room and comfortable bed

Negative_Review: Everything was positive to us Grand daughter me Loved it
Positive_Review: Some times you find a wonderful unexpected experience This was one Loved everything about this hotel Been telling everyone about this wonderful find Large rooms Executive lounge All pluses

Negative_Review: They weren t particularly helpful when I tried to arrange an early check in
Positive_Review: Nice gesture in providing us with some cake to celebrate my 70th birthday

Negative_Review: Late notice of move more expensive journeys to and from the event I was attending I booked into the Tara and was told that it was nearer to where my dinner was being held itn wasn t and I was very late The staff at the Copthorne Fulham were fantastic but the comms between the two hotels was poor
Positive_Review: Great reception staff at the Copthorne in Fulham I was moved from the Tara to the Fulham one at late notice it cost me extra on the tube as this was in Zone 2

Negative_Review: Our only quibbles were that the room was very hot we were at the back end of a heatwave in London and the air conditioning was very very noisy and the windows did not open at all Also strangely the supplies of toiletries provided did not include a shower gel or hand soap
Positive_Review: Staff were very helfpful and friendly Room was spacious and comfortable We did not eat in the hotel as we preferred to use the numerous cafes and restaurants very close by in Kensington High Street but did have a drink in the bar which was very pleasant

Negative_Review: Room very stuffy with no access to fresh air Bed had very firm mattress which affected my back
Positive_Review: The location was excellent the staff extremely helpful and friendly Good free internet access

Negative_Review: I ve stayed here a lot over the years which makes it feel a bit home from home for me however the rooms are getting very tired now and bathrooms really aren t up to par Staff always amazing and that s what keeps me coming back however Copthorne please please re vitalise your rooms
Positive_Review: Staff here are always friendly and helpful Location is good too

Negative_Review: Many facilities shop etc were shut when I got back from a concert at 10pm This is not late if returning from a show so was disappointing I had booked an accessible room but it was difficult to find my way around I could have phoned reception for advice but it shouldn t have needed that Had to get out of bed to switch off the light as was intimidated by all the alarm buttons and couldn t find the bedside light switch for fear of summoning help by accident Better instructions to the room would help or someone should automatically accompany guests and talk them through everything It was a very small single bed It might be different if travelling with a companion as there was an adjoining door Do not know what the adjoining room was like
Positive_Review: Breakfast was excellent Staff were delightful

Negative_Review: The only thing we would have liked was a vending machine with some chocolate as we were craving some late at night and there wasn t any in the hotel haha
Positive_Review: The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming Check in wasn t a problem arrived there round 4pm and there were only a couple of people in front of us The bed was comfy shower was great and the air con worked perfectly Had reservations on it from reading previous reviews but we stayed in London on one of the hottest days of the year and it kept the room at a good temp

Negative_Review: a lift or disability access from the car park to reception would be good
Positive_Review: The friendliness and general demeanour of all staff They were exemplary and made us welcome from the first meeting registering till when we left

Negative_Review: Bathroom door did not shut properly Ran out of tissues and toilet paper
Positive_Review: Delicious Eggs Benedict Royal cooked perfectly Excellent customer service All staff very polite

Negative_Review: Excellent location Great hotel for business stays or tourists as Kensington Palace and Royal Albert Hall are not far away The skyline view from the 12th Floor and executive breakfast made the stay particularly enjoyable I would stay again
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Fridge in room was a bit noisy and could not locate a switch to turn off as we were not using it but this is a minor fault
Positive_Review: Nice comfortable room No noise from outside

Negative_Review: Rooms a bit tired a c very poor not particularly efficient and very noisy
Positive_Review: Staff and general facilities seemed very good only there one night so don t have a particularly informed view

Negative_Review: Nothing to dislike
Positive_Review: Very clean Comfortable beds Very quiet Very close to Kensington high street Lovely bars loads of very good places to buy good food Good base for touring London

Negative_Review: Our room had an awful smell of dampness I did report it the carepet was soaking wet from the air on I think that is where the smell came from I had to spray the room with perfume and deodorant to try and help get rid of the smell it made me feel quite sick
Positive_Review: I like it as it was a buffet very good food

Negative_Review: This was my second business trip to this hotel in one month I stayed a total of 10 days on two business trips in the Club Room level of the Hotel and I will not be going back The first night at the hotel was a disaster The noise was so bad from the Air conditioning units outside that I had to change my room three times To give the hotel some credit they did try hard to resolve the problem but the issue is the hotel itself rather than the personnel working there This hotel needs an upgrade especially the Double Glazing There is absolutely no soundproofing at this hotel and all the noise from outside can be heard in the room I was there with two other work colleagues who all complained of the same issue One of my colleagues who stayed on the other side of the Hotel said that he could hear the Train literally passing in Stereo through his room all night We all went to our conferences very tired and agitated The crazy thing about this experience was that we stayed in the Club Room level of the Hotel These were supposed to be some of the best rooms in the Hotel The other thing I noticed was the beds do not have fitted Bed sheets covering the matress They just use Flat sheets which means that in the morning you are often lying on top of the mattress with half a sheet under you This cannot be hyginic and is not something that I have seen in other hotels The bed was also very hard and uncomfortable Certainly not what you would expect from this standard of Hotel As part of my job I spend at least 2 weeks of every month travelling around Europe and unfortunately I have to give this hotel 4 10
Positive_Review: The best thing about this hotel is the location near to High street Kensington But do not expect to sleep well at this hotel as there is absolutely no soundproofing and beds are hard and uncomfortable

Negative_Review: Noise of trains was terrible up to 2 am and started again at 5 30am It was the hottest week in 20 years but it was really uncomfortable as windows did not open and the air con did not work that well and very noisy when on so had to turn off
Positive_Review: Nice staff

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Breakfast was extra in the Exec Lounge and was paid for it was poor slow service and bad value for money it was over subscribed so table space was limited

Negative_Review: The power sockets for charging phones or batteries were located in awkward places like corner of the room a few centimeters from the ground Better if they were located at site and height of bedside table of writing table
Positive_Review: i liked being just a 5 to 7 minute walk to the underground the rooms were spacious clean and comfortable the staff from doorman to front desk were all polite and helpful

Negative_Review: the lounge was very busy at the time we went for breakfast we must have chosen a popular time It was difficult to get a table and the staff seemed overstretched or inadequately trained They were all very frienfly and courteous but it seemed rather chaotic for a short while The cutlery given was inadequate fork knife and spoon I would have liked a side knife to spread the butter etc a fork to use with my spoon for the fresh fruit and a teaspoon That caused unnecessary delay and duplication of work for the waiters as we waited for them to be brought from the kitchen
Positive_Review: We paid extra to use the executive lounge and this was well worth the extra cost The small shop at the entrance was invaluable we bought tasty fresh sandwiches for our journey home

Negative_Review: Breakfast no up to much If staying here again wouldn t bother with it Plenty of nice little cafes up the road
Positive_Review: Great location very near to tube station room basic but clean and quiet

Negative_Review: No hairdryer I asked the maid in my area She did not speak English had no idea what I was asking Since my hair was wet there was no point in calling for a dryer as my hair would have been dry before the dryer arrived
Positive_Review: The location is good Tube station buses just round the corner

Negative_Review: I suppose the room could have been a bit bigger but arriving from a number of days in France the room seemed big enough
Positive_Review: This was our second visit to The Copthorne Tara We stayed in a Club Room which is on the top floors of the hotel The room included a very good continental breakfast with hot choices such as scrambled eggs and sausage served nicely in the Club Lounge Also included was access to wine and beer for an hour and a half in the evening served in the same lounge The bed was very comfortable and the room had a nicely appointed bathroom

Negative_Review: the hotel is badly needing up graded the furniture was very worn the pillows were as flat as pancakes the bedding should be binned new quilt covers are not expensive the food at breakfast was not hot
Positive_Review: The only thing was the convenience to underground

Negative_Review: The room was not as depicted in the photographs The TV was malfunctioning The Commode had stains the hand shower was jerky The purse of two of our friends was stolen from the restaurant during breakfast time
Positive_Review: The staff were excellent

Negative_Review: Have stayed before On this occasion the room was awful Grubby carpets Torn bed surrounds Raw plugs in several places where items removed Tv not working Spoke to reception Hotel very busy Only there one night and too late to move on
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: The hotel public areas are OK but the room they originally put me in was grim room 38 on the mezzanine in case you need to avoid I had booked myself into a double room and inadvertently to one where mobility could be assisted I found myself in a single room at the far end of the corridor on the mezzanine which looked like it hadn t been refurbished in decades and which reminded me of a run down hospital with bed and bath lifts The windows didn t open and there was a stale smell the chair had a stain which I feared was urine I really could believe they were charging central London four star prices for this and felt people with mobility difficulties would get a terribly raw deal They did transfer me to a double room that was merely shabby rather than grim I have made a mental note to never return here
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: I could hear the neighbours through the wall which wasn t too bad as they didn t come back late and didn t have the TV on but if they had it would have been noisy
Positive_Review: The bed was very comfortable and the room a decent size It was in a nice quiet location and I could hear birds singing in the morning It was a lovely walk across Hyde Park to where I work

Negative_Review: Toilet is very loud as it is being refilled with water Airco is ancient and very loud but it works
Positive_Review: Room was quiet enough check in was fast You could switch off the fridge Chromecast was avalaible for the tv so that we could watch Netflix in the evenings

Negative_Review: Pillows are too soft
Positive_Review: Room and bathroom size are good Near highstreet kensington station with Marks and Spencer and Boots Quite a number of cafes There s Madonald s too

Negative_Review: Service was a little slow around reception and checking in otherwise all was fine
Positive_Review: The location and underground car parking make this a best choice for travellers by car wishing to stay in central London

Negative_Review: Nothing
Positive_Review: All was lovely I would recommend this property to anyone who wants reasonable accommodation and food close to the tube at a very reasonable price

Negative_Review: Upgrade to superior room with breakfast breakfast good but room far from superior not worth extra money I suspect room would of been the same My advice ask to view both rooms then decide
Positive_Review: Great location

Negative_Review: Room we were given was in the lower ground and was not 4 star standard It was very dark and claustrophobic also the bed was very small I doubt it was a full size double As we were strapped for time I did not request another room We have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and have been happy with the rooms which is why I was so disappointed this time
Positive_Review: The breakfast was good value

Negative_Review: I rang the hotel direct to try and book parking and was told to book through Justpark com However this cost 15 extra which I assumed would be refunded at the hotel as they advertised 25 parking fee This was not the case staff saying they didn t know anything about it I was very unhappy but the staff tried to be helpful and gave us free breakfasts to make up for the overpayment we d incurred In the future though all hotel staff need to give the same correct information
Positive_Review: Very helpful staff comfy bed and tasty breakfast

Negative_Review: Tipping at 10
Positive_Review: Excellent hotel with very helpful staff and easy check in out Room was very comfortable although we had a problem with the room key that had to be replaced several times Good breakfast everyday and extra places to eat dinner

Negative_Review: nothing
Positive_Review: good location given a room upgrade on arrival which was unexpected and very nice room very good size with good clean facilities good breakfast plenty of choice and nice restaurant pleasant and efficient staff

Negative_Review: the only thing that let the place down was the fact that our room also overlooked high street kensington tube station so noise from trains coming and going was at times a little annoying especially early inn the morning and late at night
Positive_Review: Very clean Well run We upgraded to a club room on arrival so can t compare to what we would have had But the added benefit of breakfast and drinks with canapes made it well worth the extra cost The room had a great view of the London skyline So all in all a thoroughly enjoyable stay

Negative_Review: Lifts Busy at breakfast and didn t always stop on the floor you wanted ended up going up and down a few times before getting to floor 6
Positive_Review: Over all the hotel was very good Breakfast was lovely and lots of choice Would have liked porridge It wasn t on offer but not the end of the world

Negative_Review: Poor communications skills and lack of curtesy of restaurant staff
Positive_Review: Proximity to major attractions Quick access to the train network Happy Hour after a big day out Bistro Public Bar General friendliness helpfullness of front of house staff

Negative_Review: No complimentary shower gel in bathroom or walk in shower Room service menu limited and expensive if required after 10 pm Food in bar restaurant average Though plenty of choice close by In hindsight I would have waited to book until much closer the time as room prices drop dramatically on line and breakfast is also included in deals Anyone booking two days before my visit was paying 60 less than me and had breakfast included A little annoying considering I honoured my booking reservation
Positive_Review: Bright clean room Good air conditioning Good choice of 3 on site restaurants or other local well known eating places Wide choice for breakfast Friendly helpful staff 2 mins walk to Kensington High Street and tube Easy 20 min walk to museums and 15 min to Royal Albert Hall Hyde park minutes away so handy for lovely walk to Serpentine etc

Negative_Review: Despite requesting an extra bed with booking com AND calling the property direct to ensure ok AND confirming and paying for this at check in there was still no extra bed The room was small and the sink blocked Also a bit noisy as put in a room on a railway track Room was also very stuffy had to go into corridors for air
Positive_Review: Food available late and fantastic choice for breakfast

Negative_Review: No plug in the bath so I had to take a shower water wasn t very hot Room could have done with a lick of paint as it was starting to look tired
Positive_Review: Staff were very friendly during check in and out Breakfast was excellent and the waiting staff were always asking if I wanted more coffee Chef overheard me asking for Hash browns and personally went off to get me some

Negative_Review: I could have put excellent but as i have booked 6 nights stay i was given a room on he 2nd floor next to he station so you can imagine as if i was sleeping in the station itself Every 5 10 mins i was awaken by the train arrival at the station i lost almost all day next waiting to be given another room finally i had a room at about 2 30 with 2 SINGLES bed on the 6th floor
Positive_Review: I have REALLY Appreciated the early check in thank You so much The Staff at the lounge Club EXCELLENT Especially there is a lady that i would like to send a special thoughts she works in the evening

Negative_Review: I waited for about 10 minutes in the bar bistro for anyone to acknowledge me and bring a food menu Eventually I went to get this myself After another 5 minutes I still had nobody attend to me so I left to eat elsewhere
Positive_Review: Large clean room with good heating cooling system

Negative_Review: The bedrooms and bathroom s are looking tired based on modern hotel standards but the price for a central London hotel reflects this The hotel is very good value for it s location
Positive_Review: Very good stay as usual

Negative_Review: hearing people talking etc in the room next door they did not answer their wake up call until the third attempt to contact them and we had to say answer your phone in our room before they did Although we were out of the room by 9 and did not return till 4 it had not been cleaned more than enough time for this to have occurred The white wine in the bar is mingling
Positive_Review: It was within reasonable walking distance from the tube station Very nice Thai restaurant round the corner

Negative_Review: The price of Pringles for the little cartons The fact that there was no easily accessible tea coffee snacks after 10pm My son is a type 1 diabetic and I had to leave the hotel and go to holiday inn next door after 10pm to get something fir him to eat I didn t like leaving him i couldn t risk using room service and have it take ages but I didn t like going out at night
Positive_Review: It served our purpose Clearly it monitors Twitter too

Negative_Review: No issues
Positive_Review: The staff were superb clearly a very well managed hotel Our room was great the deal for breakfast added value All in all with parking costs it was not a cheap stay but it is London We would definitely consider this hotel again

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: This hotel was Great the staff were very helpful and friendly the location for the Royal albert hall was a 10 minutes walk with loads of shops and restaurants added bonus was the underground car parking and was amazed that we booked a Club Room cheaper than other hotels and we got complementary drinks and a great breakfast in the executive lounge would go back to this hotel again and certainly highly recommend this hotel

Negative_Review: Breakfast was a little rushed I appreciate a lot of people had to be given breakfast but pleas do not take your plate as soon as one has finished the last mouthful
Positive_Review: The check in was very quick and efficient despite a long qu It is so central within walking distance The hotel is very clean and reasonably priced for the heart of London Staff were polite and helpful I would recommend hotel for anyone planning a shopping trip or trip to the museuns or parks or the albert hall as you can walk there and back easily

Negative_Review: We booked a standard room which was a suitable size but found the bed too small so if I stayed again would select another room There were no spare pillows or duvets which would be convenient to have in the room We did request them and received them
Positive_Review: Location to public transport tube station a short walk Restaurants cafes and shops very close and convenient

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Upgraded to a Superior room category Good size room for a short stay and comfortable bed Room included iron ironing board hairdryer safe plus tea coffee making facilities

Negative_Review: The hotels car park staff Seem to have a little side earner going where they told us to pay them directly cash for parking but when we went in and asked at the front desk we were told they should never ask for cash and that this was wrong And they then played it off as it must of been a practical joke between the front desk attendant and car park attendant I thought this was discussing that this is going on not only could I have been charged twice for parking but I also didn t know who to believe or who was telling the truth or who to pay So others should be warned of this
Positive_Review: The hotel was very clean and tidy

Negative_Review: bathroom needs to be updated Towels looked worn out double bed could be a bit bigger should be a queen size bed
Positive_Review: location to underground was good close to shops and restaurants

Negative_Review: GETTING into our Room early say mid day without the extra charge
Positive_Review: ROOM was first Class spacious and very clean Good Quality bathroom and appreciate the Bottle of Water in Hotel Room when we arrived and the TEA COFFEE making facilities The Price of room for the night was excellent within our budget One downside we had to wait until 3pm UNLESS we paid extra to go into our room to unpack freshen up and go out on a site seeing tour BUT everything else was good

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The bed was really comfy and the bathroom is really nice although the water runs really slow I hope they can sort this out The hotel was fab Will be going here again x

Negative_Review: None
Positive_Review: The reception officer is very friendly and helpful The Breakfast is great There are also connecting room provided which is very suitable for our family group

Negative_Review: We would like to have been warned that we needed to use the keycard to make the lifts work We were puzzled the first time we used a lift
Positive_Review: The staff were friendly and always available to answer any questions There was no queuing for breakfast Staff found us a table straight away facilities in the room such as TV Aircon etc were all good My friend and I liked the easy access to the tube and the buses on High Street Kensington

Negative_Review: Nothing major to gripe about other than room possibly needs upgrading in the near future
Positive_Review: Great value great location good facilities overall would recommend to any business traveller

Negative_Review: Unfortunately I got double charged on my room and the staff just tried to talk around the issue and didn t really take responsibility Checked out two days ago and they still haven t taken off the double charge and my bank says it can take another week absolutely not okey The staff s attitude just made it worse and the whole experience gets ruined I would never give them my credit card details again
Positive_Review: Great room with all the facilities you would need Great size bathroom and feels very clean

Negative_Review: We had to ask for extra towels and they only arrived a hour after asking for them Air condition had poor adjustment and could not get it cooler
Positive_Review: Room was clean and decent size

Negative_Review: There was nothing that we didn t like
Positive_Review: We were told we were guest of the day and were upgraded to a Premier Room with better views of London and direct access to the Premier Club lounge with complimentary drinks and canap s which was a lovely gesture All of the receptionists were lovely and friendly very well groomed and knowledgable The hotel shop was excellent and the lady that runs it was very nice and friendly

Negative_Review: Two of the staff did not speak English well and were difficult to understand as such they were not able to help with a simple question
Positive_Review: Fantastic location and right next to public transit and High Street shopping restaurants Holland Park Portabello Markets and other attractions only a short walk from the property Concierge staff to be complimented on their courtesy and helpfulness with arranging taxis and boarding cards for by British Airways flight Restaurants and breakfast great

Negative_Review: Complete mess up with the rooms resulting in 5 of us having 15 mins to get ready in 1 room after a long day Check in later still not smooth nearly midnight when we got our rooms Check in queues unacceptably long 1 hour An absence of staff on reception desks lifts unable to accommodate volume of guests causing long delays bottlenecks No signs to staircases either Breakfast also very busy
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: reception gave me room key I went to the room and there was a guest inside the room so bad my TV didn t work and after 4 calls they came the next day to fix which really bothered me
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: A layer of dust on the glass top above the fridge which put a doubt over cleanliness and room supervision
Positive_Review: Stayed in a club room and the club status was good vfm The staff at reception executive room cocktail bar were excellent The view from the top floor of the city was great

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Everything was good with the property staff and food We were very lucky and appreciative for the lucky guest upgrade It was a lovely surprise after our long trip from Sydney

Negative_Review: Only had breakfast once Much too noisy and busy Breakfast nothing special just OK
Positive_Review: The location Ease of checking in and out Room clean and beds comfortable

Negative_Review: Reception area not very helpful Did not give any information on basic facilities at check in had to find out for ourselves No maps of area available Always queues for one concierge on duty
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Check in early Sunday afternoon Not enough staff were available When I got to the desk the check in was really fast pleasant and efficient but standing in a queue for 20 mins before getting to the desk was unpleasant and in my opinion unnecessary Other clients were unhappy and complained about the delays Not good feedback for the hotel Guest services desk staff were brilliant with guidance on maps trains buses etc Again on occasion more staff would have speeded up the process Timing is the key You need to research when are the busy times and schedule staff appropriately Overall guest services were great
Positive_Review: The hotel was very near an underground The Bugis restaurant was excellent Check in was really slow and took about 30 minutes Customers in front of me were also complaining This is not good

Negative_Review: Poorly fitting curtains Adjoining room door made noise levels difficult Fridge cupboard door kept opening Plastic food container left behind bedside cabinet
Positive_Review: Fridge in room Tea coffee making facilities

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: In general we were satisfied with accommodation and facilities However a stairway alternative to the lifts was confusing to say the least and I would recommend addressing this problem The handle for the toilet cistern was not good even when it worked it would be impossible for someone with arthritis to operate the handle did infact break on our morning of departure Finally I was disappointed in the breakfast Cold food and Cold plates

Negative_Review: We didn t get the room as requested And they made a big issue when we asked for what was booked When checking out there was someone else bar drinks on our bill and we not no apology for inconvenience
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Dirty toilet dusty room shower control would not turn down scolding water to shower in Basin tap moved when turned on and off
Positive_Review: Good breakfast excellent location near tube station

Negative_Review: Although room comfy aircon was noisy and as we had fab weather it needed to be on There are no opening windows safety I suppose May be a little far out of the city for those that are less mobile and struggle with public transport although we had no problems getting a taxi we paid 20 to get close to city centre and 30 to get back from the Shard
Positive_Review: We booked club rooms for our stay located on the upper floors of the hotel The views were amazing rooms spacious and comfortable We found the staff to be very accommodating and friendly Ate in the restaurant both evenings the food was exceptional and reasonably priced Public transport a short walk away along with a good selection of shops We would consider staying here again Kensington Gardens 10 minute walk away

Negative_Review: You have to request ice through room service Called down for a bucket around 7pm Called again with a gentle reminder at 7 30 He s on his way up Called again 15 minutes later and was told they would contact room service again we had dialled room service but whatever After a further ten minutes my husband went down to the bar himself No one brought us ice
Positive_Review: Great brekfast buffet Free wine beer and appies from 6 30 8 00 pm Server was certainly not stingy with topping off your glass You simply MUST eat at the Bugis Street Brasserie

Negative_Review: We were given a single disabled room to start with then the lift did not work so we changed lifts Arrived at next room seems to be that hotel rooms only buy small beds 2 3 is not a lot of room to sleep on And the bed side light switch did not work
Positive_Review: We did arrive quite late and did leave quite early so did not truly experience much of the hotel

Negative_Review: It took ages to check in We went in at 5pm and they didn t have ourinformation so gave us a complimentary drink voucher to have at the bar but when we went back they still didn t have the information 2 hours later we were late for our concert due to this
Positive_Review: The staff at the bar

Negative_Review: The bathroom lighting was a little too low
Positive_Review: We were upgraded to Club Rooms which meant breakfast and use of the club lounge were included It is 2 minutes from Kensington High Street so great location without being on the main road We were in London as we were going to the Royal Albert Hall which was an easy 10 15 minute walk away

Negative_Review: The bedroom was small very noisy old fashioned not very clean The aircon was smelly and could not be used which made the room stuffy You could hear the people in the room next door Someone came into our room in the morning a housekeeper I guess and left without ensuring the door was closed
Positive_Review: THE PROPERTY WAS WELL SITUATED TO THE UNDERGROUND SHOPS ETC

Negative_Review: Room very out dated and fridge was old which made loud noises through the day and night Sink was blocked so I spoke to reception and they sent someone to fix it
Positive_Review: Fairly quiet

Negative_Review: 1 The signature restaurant in the hotel Artists Corner was unavailable pre booked for a function and this also occurred when we visited previously 2 The building and furnishings were perhaps a little tired
Positive_Review: 1 Location 2 Club room was comfortable and the free refreshments wine an canopies from 18 30h to 20 00h were much appreciated and were one of the reasons we returned

Negative_Review: Reception staff language problems and long waiting times Bed too small Bell boy did not offer assistance with three cases
Positive_Review: Great location and good price

Negative_Review: The bed was awful two single beds zipped together which hurt if you rolled over on it and the bed was way to hard not comfortable at all and the sheets were never changed at all in the five days we were there very poor
Positive_Review: The location was spot on and the staff and general hotel was brilliant

Negative_Review: Rooms are satisfactory but nothing to write home about
Positive_Review: Breakfast was excellent food in abundance staff very attentive Great value and should not be missed

Negative_Review: Reception staff indifferent and lacking in knowledge Rooms a little tired Signature restaurant closed for duration to facilitate a small group
Positive_Review: Public areas well maintained Choice of bars

Negative_Review: The rooms were a little warm It was hard to get them cool enough even with the heating aircon If the weather had been hot this would have been a problem
Positive_Review: Very well located Spacious clean rooms plenty of clothes storage especially for a city hotel Coffee shop in foyer and happy hour cocktails appreciated

Negative_Review: Ordered food in bar order was taken and 8 starters came mine s had been put down as a main so was left sitting for 15 min waiting on mine to come when I complained staff response was awful seemed like so what ruined my evening
Positive_Review: The hotel facilities

Negative_Review: Though the bed was comfy the pillows feel weird I m not sure that the pillows were suitable Also the toilets is very clean it is old It do look old and the bath smells old
Positive_Review: The bed is comfy the room size is really good and the overall experience is amazing

Negative_Review: Only the cocktail bar
Positive_Review: Friendly helpful staff The hotel is well served with staff who are well trained and keen to please The room was clean and offered all the facilities one needs Shame the cocktail bar wasn t available during our stay but the general bar was open for drinks

Negative_Review: We upgraded to Club on check in which was supposed to give us a newspaper we tried to track down our newspaper but we were not successful on either mornings
Positive_Review: The club lounge for breakfast It was quieter than the usual dining room Breakfast was also very good the staff were very attentive

Negative_Review: Staff attitude in restaurant to someone who had pre ordered gluten free food was not good We felt we were being a nuisance we can t understand why housekeeping kept trying to come into the room twice each day at times that were hours ahead of our checkout time rather concerned

Negative_Review: Often a long ish queue wait at reception Near tube line so inevitably noisy despite double glazing and A C
Positive_Review: Convenient fridge and tea coffee making facilities Good ratio of lifts to clients Caring concierge staff Good car parking facility Good wifi connection available Efficient house keeping staff All staff very good and friendly

Negative_Review: Nothing in particular
Positive_Review: Breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of food from several cultures Did not use restaurant at any other time Very helpful pleasant staff who were polite respectful without being effusive

Negative_Review: Breakfast can t be charged to one s room account you have to pay cash or with credit card at the entrance unless you book at checking in then you get it on your room account This is stone age but obviously the hotel s policy
Positive_Review: Nice and stylish restaurant facilities good offers

Negative_Review: Many of the staff didn t speak English and couldn t understand me Shower was noisy Needs a make over
Positive_Review: Comfortable bed Breakfast was great Good location

Negative_Review: Wifi was very slow The reception was short staffed at the busy time in the morning I waited for 10 mins to check out but there still were 5 people in front of me So I opted to give my key to one of the staff managing the queue and asked them to leave the receipt at the concierge so that I can collect it later
Positive_Review: 3 minute walk from the Highstreet Kensington station The room was larger than the other similar hotels I had stayed in London and clean Staff at the concierge were nice and helpful

Negative_Review: Nothing If your previous clients didn t highlight the broken shower it is difficult to mend We did so the next people to use 1081 should have a good shower
Positive_Review: We were upgraded a very nice greeting stay here every year to do a miniature show however the shower was broken so didn t get a shower in the morning usually your showers are fantastic very nice free breakfast to start our long day will always stay with you as very convenient and friendly

Negative_Review: Wifi was very very slow I couldn t even check emails I booked a double room but at the check in I was told a double room was not available They said they could zip up two single beds in a twin room but I would have to wait for a while since no staff was available I exhausted from a long flight opted for bearing with a single bed As always the case with this hotel the reception is short staffed and I had to queue for 10 minutes or so just to check in and out
Positive_Review: Conveniently located within 5 minute walk from a Tube station The room was spacious based on the London standard and clean One of the concierge guys was very kind and helpful

Negative_Review: Queues at Breakfast time Seemed to be more guests than the restaurant could cope with
Positive_Review: Convenient location relative to the event that we attended in RAH

Negative_Review: Safety security box was placed too low down Difficulty keying in code unless went on knees especially when on the elderly side I didn t notice any recycling centre bins
Positive_Review: It was quiet clean and comfortable Close to public transport Contained fridge in room Room service was quick

Negative_Review: A few more 13 amp power sockets clearly visible above desk unit ie charging mobile tablet etc It took a while to work out why the television was not working Had to turn on and off at set itself rather than use the remote Perhaps we have missed something about the standby mode

Negative_Review: Seating area outside not kept tidy Bins full and overflowing need to address for summer
Positive_Review: Great location Near tube station Comfortable beds Staff attentive

Negative_Review: Pillows were a little uncomfortable Room temperature very difficult to control with the AC system
Positive_Review: Good location Good value for money for a London hotel

Negative_Review: Bed small and pillows very hard Plugs to charge iPads etc are difficult to access as they are all at floor level Room and bathroom generally in need of refurbishment
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: The rioom was no more than average and the bathroom needed updating not 4 standard
Positive_Review: The general hotel facilities staff responses guest support were great

Negative_Review: The beds were very uncomfortable and the pillows had no support whatsoever The toilet didn t flush also The bar staff were very unprofessional
Positive_Review: Location to Albert hall was good

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Great welcoming by and helpful staff Receptionist informed us we had been awarded guests of the day and where given free access to the Club Room free breakfast and upgraded to Club Room Nice touch that was much appreciated

Negative_Review: The Asian staff at the reservation desk were very rude They are impatient and impolite and do not know the meaning of customer service and care They are not trained to speak professionally and respectfully to guests The experience has been bad and shocking
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: The club lounge was very dark and the only seating was tables and chairs no sofas or comfy chairs It was also very small considering the number of club rooms available and breakfast was packed at 9 30 with people having to share tables with other guests In the afternoon when I was there with only a few other people present the manager was conducting an interview with one of the receptionists in there I thought this very unprofessional as I could hear details of her salary etc so I left and went to sit in the lobby instead which actually was brighter and had big leather sofas
Positive_Review: We booked a club room which meant we had access to the club lounge and the tea and coffee facilities all day The room was on the 11th floor and had an amazing view back to the Albert Hall London eye etc Check out at noon was a bonus We are returning in 3 weeks time and hope we get the same bedroom

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The best value for money hotel in London Staff are very friendly rooms are spotless bar is very well run and staff exceptionally helpful Hotel is located in a great area of London 5 mins from tube station

Negative_Review: Had to ask for tea bags staff at front desk found it hard to understand wanted a sheet on bed under duvet as was hot in hotel and had to take duvet out of covers to use that then was to short after tucking in and sheets towels old

Negative_Review: Had 2 single beds which was not what i had requested in booking The rooms are somewhat dated in decoration but that is common for UK hotels
Positive_Review: Convenient located was clean and comfortable Staff helpful and friendly and i would certainly use this hotel again

Negative_Review: Rooms at the back of the hotel get rail noise try and get a room at the front Why do rooms have a fridge but nothing in it Bottled water would have been nice Pretty basic need
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Service from reception Room wasn t ready on time and unsuitable room eventually given Complaint was resolved by manager after 1 hour
Positive_Review: Comfy bed excellent service at breakfast good location

Negative_Review: my daughter s room had extended their stay until 8pm which meant she had to sleep in another room away from the children they had book adjoining rooms club class this wasn t good as they had paid in advance for the room and therefore room and those extending should have been moved
Positive_Review: club room access

Negative_Review: I was offered and signed up to a bargain flash price via Booking com which when my bank statement arrived later had not been applied Angry about this
Positive_Review: Breakfast snacks bought at Coffee shop excellent

Negative_Review: Thought I should have been at least offered a reduction as staying 3 nights and 1st night terrible because of room and noise
Positive_Review: Loved the coissents but had to change rooms after first night as my room had a locked interconnecting door and people were talking all night

Negative_Review: The bedroom was dated considering it was meant to be a superior room and very small bed Basically I was disappointed for the amount of money I paid
Positive_Review: the staff were very friendly

Negative_Review: Long queue of 12 at reception waiting to book in only 1 desk open with a member of staff
Positive_Review: Got upgraded with free breakfast because of long queue to book in at reception I had altered my booking on line but hotel did not have details Alessandro however apologised sincerely made me feel important smile

Negative_Review: The twin room you gave me in the first place standard does not have to mean unacceptable air system was outdated and awful Wifi with problems not working properly
Positive_Review: What I like the least was that your IT helpdesk from the hotel 1 person was unbelievably rude with me and the Wifi didn t work until the last day that apparently you changed without advising the guest I had to call numerous times to reception to sort out this problem also if it wasn t for the upgrade of twin room you gave me out of my discomfort in the normal twin you offer it would have been a nightmare like the film the shining movie long corridors 5 min to the lifts and also the air conditioning system is almost Victorian there was bad smell and noise as I said the upgrade of a superior twin room on the fifth floor saved our stay from misery The hotel overall need renovation urgently Some members of staff were nice but the receptionist were so serious and out of charm absolutely unpleasant

Negative_Review: Booking com says the hotel is 5 minutes From The Royal Albert ahall by Taxi yes by foot no it takes 40 minutes by foot considering breakfast was served from 7 30am to 1 30 staff were clearing up by 9 45 Did feel like we were being rushed a bit Lovley hotel would use again
Positive_Review: Very helpful staff rooms were very clean close to Kensington shopping area

Negative_Review: The porter was trying to be helpful but I found him rather unnerving as he did not explain what he was doing and just took our cases somewhere We then had to get them back because we needed them immediately The reception staff were rather slow and there was some confusion because I had paid via Booking com the day before and been told the payment had been taken then the hotel reception staff told me I had to pay As it turned out only one payment was taken There was pretty much anything you wanted for breakfast but the porridge was made with water and was very watery and the toaster only toasted on one side of the bread Some cranberry juice would have also been nice
Positive_Review: The room was comfortable and the bathroom was clean

Negative_Review: As above
Positive_Review: Breakfast staff did not have good command of English Chef had to come out to translate my request for porridge with water But it was a good meal

Negative_Review: on arrival offered an upgrade at cost of 30 pounds each night with breakfast thrown in fair enough but lighting failed in room on 1st night fixed next day then on 2nd night it happened again electrician came to room to try and fix it this was 11pm finally moved rooms at 12midnight complained next morning and promised full refund of upgrade 60 still waiting contacted duty manager this evening 25 4 whos busy promised to phone back still waiting oh and the rooms are dated and if you get room 933 the fridge keeps kicking in like a jet engine
Positive_Review: close to Albert Hall

Negative_Review: Size of bathroom and lighting in bathroom and main room Breakfast was good choice but cold difficult to get a cup of coffee would have been better to be able to help yourself rather than have to be served by a very busy and hard working staff member
Positive_Review: Pleasant area to walk around in the evenings Way to get to central London by tube or bus

Negative_Review: The staff in the bar restaurant were slow and due to us being on a small time scale didn t seem to move any faster once we had made them aware With having troubles with the hotel from the beginning they took payment twice once without my consent which emptied my account and then could not issue a refund for 10 days They promised me a room upgrade for all of the party well if they upgraded my room god knows what the standard rooms were like The bed was clean but very small and we had no room to roll over Breakfast was pricey and a little disappointing
Positive_Review: The location was perfect right around the corner from the Kensington Roof Gardens so was a short walk away and a short walk back The staff were accommodating and helpful

Negative_Review: Duvet was a little thin no extra blankets in room
Positive_Review: Having a fridge in the room was great The hotel is situated spvclose to an underground station and shops making it an ideal location

Negative_Review: The room was very warm when we first went in but left the air con on for a while and it was great
Positive_Review: Brilliant stay we paid for an Upgrade on arrival and it was superb Early check in superior room free drink from the bar bottle of water and full cooked breakfast for an amazing upgrade price of 30 per room

Negative_Review: Could have done with a completely separate room for a restaurant that served a good choice of different foods The bar area seems to join the restaurant and didn t have anybody on the desk There was another restaurant serving far eastern food
Positive_Review: Good breakfast and location

Negative_Review: Free wifi was slow
Positive_Review: Very near the Underground Room was modern clean large quiet and sunny Staff very knowledgeable and very helpful and very attentive

Negative_Review: Our room was on the railway side which meant a little noise at times
Positive_Review: Fantastic breakfast selection Good bar and restaurant facilities Room bright and comfortable Staff were very polite and helpful Location is close to local facilities and nearby shopping

Negative_Review: Nothing
Positive_Review: There was a great selection at breakfast Our tv wasn t working and a lovely man was swapping it over at midnight no trouble lovely staff could not do enough for us would highly recommend this hotel

Positive_Review: Comfy bed excellent shower Great fast lift friendly girl at the desk on checking out

Negative_Review: Old fashioned room shower curtain breakfast view from the room hotel exterior expensive not worthy of 4 stars
Positive_Review: cocktail bar comfy bed good location

Negative_Review: Wait at reception to check and wasn t aware of the express check out
Positive_Review: Good breakfast near to tube station and good access to near by attractions i e Royal Albert Hall Natural History Museum etc

Negative_Review: Room bathroom in particular could do with a makeover looking tired but everything was functional
Positive_Review: Bed comfy excellent breakfast evening meal in Brassiere tasty good value staff very helpful friendly All in all a good experience

Negative_Review: Staff at breakfast walked about shouting Coffeeeeee Teeeeeeee would have been nicer for them to have come to the table a just asked what we wanted They were very noisy
Positive_Review: Great location on site parking choice of restaurants bed was comfortable hotel was quiet overnight Checking in and out was simple

Negative_Review: The afternoon tea was awful bread was stale not value for money glad I only paid 19 instead of 40 was not worth 19 let alone 40 very very dissapointed
Positive_Review: The bed was very comfy

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The rooms and location are excellent The staff are always welcoming and helpful I enjoy the range of food offered at breakfast and love the Bugis Street restaurant I have stayed at the hotel on numerous occasions and intend to stay again when I next visit London

Negative_Review: Noise insulation was very poor We could hear the overground rail services running frequently and the fridge in the room was noisy Neither of us got a good night of sleep
